newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: JCI Ltd says Ghana exploration going well.
newsitem.headline: JCI Ltd says Ghana exploration going well.

text.p: JCI Ltd said on Tuesday it was satisfied with exploration progress at Prestea, the gold mine it manages in Ghana.

JCI gold and uranium chief executive officer John Brownrigg said at the company's September quarter results presentation that satisfactory progress was being made in a phased development programme which would see the mine fully taken over by JCI.
"Surface exploration is going well, we are getting very exciting results while production from underground is progressing better than expected," Brownrigg said.
He declined to give exploration results, saying they would be released after JCI completed the second phase of the project development programme, which could be next year.
"The five-phase programme will eventually lead to a full takeover of ownership; we have management at this time," Brownrigg said.
"During the next few steps, we can decide whether we will take over ownership of the project," he said.
Prestea, which has produced about 200 tonnes of gold since 1912, is a joint venture between JCI and Barnato Exploration Ltd (Barnex).
Brownrigg said funding would be needed if a big open-cast gold-mining operation was to be developed at Prestea. "If we develop a big surface operation there, it will have to be funded."
